issue.description:
Clause 4.3.2 incorrectly states "A Document_property_representation is a type of id" , and id is an href to representation.id. Document_property_representation is in fact a type of representation.
Proposed Solution: Change href and text to representation

description.p: WR4 says that there shall not be two Document_property_representation instances with the same name; only four names are valid. How is it then possible to use Numerical_representation_context for Numerical_document_property and a normal Representation_context for Descriptive_document_property if they all shall be in the same items-set of Document_property_representation which only has a single context_of_items attribute? Or is it not foreseen to have a mixed items-set? Or shall they all use the same simple Representation_context?

comment.description: Comment agreed by commenter to be mistaken and therefore withdrawn.

description.p: This entity data type seems to be over-constrained! It seems to be tailored for shape related documents. Is it supposed to support text documents as well? What about a property like "number of lines in document"? If this entity data type shall not be applicable to represent all kinds of document properties, its name and description should make this clear.

comment.description: The property names are not mandatory. Rejection agreed with Norwegian representative to BCR workshop, Seattle, October 2004.

description.p: document_property_item is missing from the PLCS longform. there is a bug in WR1 of the ENTITY Assigned_document_property
The WR should redeclare Assigned_property.described_ element to be a document_property_item

It should redeclare Assigned_property.described_element to be a document_property_item otherwise I think, that you can assign a document property to the population of property_assignment_select
